    • Method Detail

      • selectColorable

        public void selectColorable(Languages lang)
        Selects a Colorable object based on the language
        Parameters:
        lang - the language which is one of the constants in Languages but not PLAIN_TEXT

      • enableSingleLines

        public void enableSingleLines(boolean isEnabled)
        Enables to perform coloring in single lines, where possible
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - true to enable to coloring in single lines

      • color

        public void color(java.lang.String in,
                  int pos)
        Colors text.

        Coloring is performed in single lines if enabled through enableSingleLines(boolean), otherwise the entire text is scanned.

        Parameters:
        in - the text
        pos - the current caret position

      • setCharAttrBlack

        public void setCharAttrBlack(int start,
                             int length)
        (Re-)colors a portion of text in black
        Parameters:
        start - the position where the recolored text starts
        length - the length of the text to be recolored

      • setCharAttrKeyBlue

        public void setCharAttrKeyBlue(int start,
                               int length)
        Colors a portion of text in keyword red
        Parameters:
        start - the position where the recolored text starts
        length - the length of the text to be recolored

      • keysRed

        public void keysRed(java.lang.String in,
                    java.lang.String key,
                    int pos,
                    boolean reqWord)
        Colors keywords in red
        Parameters:
        in - the text which may be a single line of the entire text
        key - the keywords
        pos - the start pos of the text within the entire text
        reqWord - if the keywords must be a word

      • keysBlue

        public void keysBlue(java.lang.String in,
                     java.lang.String key,
                     int pos,
                     boolean reqWord)
        Colors keywords in blue
        Parameters:
        in - the text which may be a single line of the entire text
        key - the keywords
        pos - the start pos of the text within the entire text
        reqWord - if the keywords must be a word

      • brackets

        public void brackets(java.lang.String in,
                     java.lang.String bracket,
                     int pos)
        Colors brackets in blue and bold
        Parameters:
        in - the text which may be a single line of the entire text
        bracket - the bracket
        pos - the start pos of the text within the entire text

      • withFlag

        public void withFlag(java.lang.String in,
                     java.lang.String flag,
                     int pos)
        Colors words that follow a flag (like $) but whose lengths is unknown in blue
        Parameters:
        in - the text which may be a single line of the entire text
        flag - the start signal for the word
        pos - the start pos of the text within the entire text

      • stringLiterals

        public void stringLiterals(java.lang.String in,
                           int pos,
                           java.lang.String blockStart,
                           java.lang.String blockEnd)
        Colors String literals
        Parameters:
        in - the text which may be a single line of the entire text
        pos - the start pos of the text within the entire text
        blockStart - the String that represents the start of a text block where the String literal must be found in. Null to ignore any ocurrence in a block
        blockEnd - the String that represents the end of a text block where the String literal must be found in. Not null if blockStart is not null

      • lineComments

        public void lineComments(java.lang.String in,
                         int pos,
                         java.lang.String lineCmnt)
        Colors line comments
        Parameters:
        in - the text which may be a single line from the entire text
        pos - the start position of the text within the entire text
        lineCmnt - the String that represents the start of line comment

      • blockComments

        public void blockComments(java.lang.String in,
                          java.lang.String blockCmntStart,
                          java.lang.String blockCmntEnd)
        Colors block comments but also recolors the text when a block is uncommented
        Parameters:
        in - the entire text
        blockCmntStart - the String that represents the start signal for a block
        blockCmntEnd - the String that represents the end signal for a bloack

      • isInBlock

        public boolean isInBlock(java.lang.String in,
                         int pos,
                         java.lang.String blockStart,
                         java.lang.String blockEnd)
        Returns if the specified pos is found in a certain block of text
        Parameters:
        in - the entire text
        pos - the position that may be found in a block of text
        blockStart - the String that defines the blocj start
        blockEnd - the String that defines the block end
        Returns:
        if the specified pos is found in a certain block of text
